verse.roman:
te śārṅga-cyuta-bāṇaughaiḥ
kṛtta-bāhv-aṅghri-kandharāḥ
nipetuḥ pradhane kecid
eke santyajya dudruvuḥ

synonyms: te—they; śārṅga—from Lord Kṛṣṇa's bow; cyuta—shot; bāṇa—of arrows; oghaiḥ—by the floods; kṛtta—severed; bāhu—whose arms; aṅghri—legs; kandharāḥ—and necks; nipetuḥ—fell; pradhane—on the battlefield; kecit—some; eke—some; santyajya—giving up; dudruvuḥ—fled.
translation: These warriors were deluged by arrows shot from the Lord's bow, Śārṅga. Some of the kings fell on the battlefield with severed arms, legs and necks; the rest gave up the fight and fled.
